meanings.definition: Existing in a person or thing from birth; innate.
meanings.sent1: Her connate talent for music was evident even as a child.
meanings.sent2: The connate ability to swim is seen in many aquatic animals.
meanings.sent3: His connate love for sweets led to a funny incident at the dessert table.
meanings.sent4: The connate bond between twins is often described as unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The connate instinct of a newborn to cry for attention is universal.

meanings.definition: Of the same origin; related by blood.
meanings.sent1: The connate siblings shared a strong family resemblance.
meanings.sent2: Their connate connection was evident in their shared traditions.
meanings.sent3: The connate cousins always had a blast at family reunions.
meanings.sent4: The connate roots of the family tree ran deep and strong.
meanings.sent5: The connate bond between the siblings was unbreakable.

meanings.definition: United or combined with something else.
meanings.sent1: The connate flavors of the dish created a unique taste.
meanings.sent2: The connate colors of the painting blended harmoniously.
meanings.sent3: The connate ingredients in the recipe made it a culinary masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The connate elements of the design formed a cohesive whole.
meanings.sent5: The connate sounds of nature filled the forest with music.
